abstract.text: A mutable description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The vImage library uses the information in an image format to construct
instances that convert to and from images encoded with the format. The format stores a description of the pixels in the image, such as color representation, bit depth, and number of channels.
instance is capable of holding an incomplete encoding representation. In this case, the
functions return an error code that indicates what information is missing.
to add the missing conversion matrix.
to add the missing chrominance siting information.
to add the missing color space that contains primaries and transfer function.
instance with other Core Video pixel buffers of the same format, such as other frames from the same movie.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Create vImage buffers with the correct dimensions to convert to and from images with subsampled chroma information.
An error code that indicates the chroma siting information is absent.
An error code that indicates the image’s color space is missing.
An error code that indicates the required conversion matrix is absent.
A mutable description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer.
Constants that specify the chrominance siting of a Core Video image format.
Constants that specify the format of a Core Video image format.
The alpha hint of the Core Video image format.
The number of channels, including alpha, for the Core Video image format.
Returns the range and clamp limits for a specified channel in a Core Video image format.
The channels of the Core Video image format.
The chrominance siting of the Core Video image format.
The color space of the Core Video image format.
The four-character code that encodes the pixel format of the Core Video image format.
Creates the description of the image encoding in an existing Core Video pixel buffer.
Creates the description of an RGB image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer from the specified properties.
Creates the description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer from the specified properties.
Copies an RGB-to-YpCbCr conversion matrix to an image format’s internal matrix.
Creates the description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer from the specified properties.
Creates the description of the image encoding in an existing Core Video pixel buffer.
Sets the chrominance siting of a Core Video image format.
Sets the color space of a Core Video image format.
An immutable description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer.
A description of a conversion from one image format to another.
Creates a vImage converter that converts a Core Graphics-formatted image to a Core Video-formatted image.
Creates a vImage converter that converts a Core Video-formatted image to a Core Graphics-formatted image.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
